item.title: Ticket #2901 (Incorrect Login Feedback) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description: Modified patch, based on Ryan's suggestions.

item.title: 2901b.diff attached to Ticket #2901
item.dc:creator: Nazgul

item.title: Ticket #2901 (Incorrect Login Feedback) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description:
Ah, hold on. I see that we aren't hitting wp_login() if the password is empty. We shouldn't need the first part of the patch, but the last part is needed. How about if empty checks for both username and password with separate messages for each. Use the same message used in wp_login(): 

'<strong>Error</strong>: The password field is empty.'

item.title: Ticket #2900 (Semantics of Previous and Next for editing posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ptvguy
item.description: Keywords changed

item.title: Ticket #2900 (Semantics of Previous and Next for editing posts) updated
item.dc:creator: ptvguy
item.description:
Here's the IRC discussion:

<teccus> when ur on a forum <teccus> previous is on the right <jeroenl> He's got a point I think. <teccus> easy mod, but irrotating and i don't want to modd it :p ... <teccus> hehe <teccus> when u are on a forum ... <teccus> and u want to go to deeper posts <teccus> its on the right hand side <teccus> not the left ... <teccus> lol, so u guys going to change it for me? <ptvGuy> Even on the WP support forum, NEXT PAGE is on the right. <jeroenl> No idea, I don't have a say in it. <jeroenl> I can just make a diff for it. <jeroenl> Yeah but you have to take the semantics in mind there. <teccus> NEXT as in, deeper to the forum <teccus> on the right <teccus> jer, exactly <jeroenl> teccus got me confused. :P <teccus> it happens sometimes.. my brain thinks to fast for my typing :) <jeroenl> I'm trying to get a feel for your suggestion. <ptvGuy> It is semantics, because we get confused by PREVIOUS, NEXT and NEWER, OLDER> ... <teccus> but whenever you go deeper into a forum, the link/button is always on the right, even if its called next, new, older ... <ptvGuy> In a forum or blog that runs newest to oldest, next is usually older until you get into an individual thread at which point NEXT is newer <teccus> 1 | 2 | 3... thats where the link for older posts in wordpress should be <teccus> lets stop talking semantics ... <teccus> DEEPER into the posts.. is on the right <ptvGuy> gotcha <teccus> to new posts.. its on the left

item.title: Ticket #2901 (Incorrect Login Feedback) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: wp_login() sets an error message if there is a bad username or password. It does so by setting the global $error var, which is kinda ugly, but it does work.

item.title: Ticket #1380 (Add Optional XSL styling to feeds output) updated
item.dc:creator: error
item.description: For the moment, at least, I'd rather see this done in a plugin, and any patches that WP might need should enable the plugin to add the necessary details into the XML declaration, rather than simply adding things to the XML declaration. For instance, an add_action('rss_xml_declaration'); hook.

item.title: Ticket #2135 (trim() plugin details) updated
item.dc:creator: error
item.description:
Keywords, Version, Milestone changed

This patch looks good.

item.title: Ticket #2901 (Incorrect Login Feedback) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status changed

Small patch which gives a 'Incorrect username or password' message on a faulty login.

Also, the 'relevant' part of the IRC discussion: 

[00:46] jared: BasB: When I access the login page, if I type admin and then hit enter there is no change and then I tend to type in my password next and it appears with admin in the top box
[00:47] jared: This not only shows anyone behind me my pass code. The same one I use for all the important stuff. But it will come up when I type admin, because the browser wants to autofill that box
[00:48] ptvGuy: I never use autfill
[00:48] ptvGuy: I've done that in a hurry
[00:49] jared: ptvGuy: I do, I think its great. But in this case its not so great. Infact I have to turn it off or reset it just to prevent this situation.
[00:50] ptvGuy: I use FireFox on a private computer with password manager so admin is all I need to type
[00:50] ptvGuy: Then, when I'm on someone else's computer with IE, I forget and get in a hurry
[00:50] BasB: First of all, don't use passwords in more than one place (especially in important ones) Second, why do you press enter after entering admin? Shouldn't that be tab?
[00:51] ptvGuy: Yeah, well, you know, when you gotta blog, you gotta blog.
[00:52] ptvGuy: Some of us get in too much of a  hurry
[00:53] ptvGuy: Anyway, I don't think that's a bug
[00:54] BasB: So you want some kind of 'username or password incorect' message? To know that you pressed the wrong button or entered the wrong user/pass?
[00:54] ptvGuy: The only possible fix for that would be hiding both the username and password fields
[00:58] ptvGuy: Anyway, I don't think that the problem you have is a bug.
[00:58] jared_: But back to the login bug. I have had this situation occur half a dozen times.
[00:59] jared_: Usually in a program when you sign in, if the name and password are not correct, you are given feed back
[00:59] ptvGuy: Most just pop you back to the login window
[01:00] jared_: In this case the feedback is missing, so if one is in a hurry or not paying strict attention one easily types the password into the visible text area of the name box
[01:00] jared_: I have only noticed this issue in wordpress
[01:01] jared_: In fact it took me quite a few minutes to figure out how to reproduce the issue. It never really made sense and as soon as I was paying attention to the login I didn't have the problem
[01:02] ptvGuy: So you want an incorrect login feedback page forcing you to choose the option to try to log in again?
[01:02] BasB: If you enter a feature request in trac, I'll create a patch that gives a 'Incorrect username or password' notification for it.

item.title: Ticket #2900 (Semantics of Previous and Next for editing posts) created
item.dc:creator: ptvguy
item.description: Suggested by teccus as a 2.0.3 bug. When viewing many posts in the Manage Posts window, the Previous and Next options at the bottom are aligned wrong. Previous is aligned left and Next is aligned right while he suggests "logically that should be previous >> and aligned to the rigth". Just offering this DIFF as a starting point for a fairly minor mod.

item.dc:creator: skeltoac
item.description:
duplicate:

Duplicate of #2886

item.title: Ticket #2898 (smilie code parsing) created
item.dc:creator: miccom
item.description:
When using 2 different smilie-codes both will not work because :d got parsed before :doh: get parsed (when using :doh:)...

for example:

':d' => 'icon_biggrin.gif',

':doh:' => 'icon_doh.gif',

phpBB, for example, can handle both smilie-codes ;)

item.title: Ticket #2897 (Title attributes on Import page can contain < and > characters) updated
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description:
Keywords, Owner, Status changed

Created a patch which does a wptexturize on the attribute, as specified in the Coding Guidelines and also does a strip_html on it, because title attributes shouldn't contain HTML markup.

item.title: Ticket #2897 (Title attributes on Import page can contain < and > characters) created
item.dc:creator: Nazgul
item.description: The title attributes on the links pointing to the different import modules can (and do) contain < and > characters, which breaks XHTML validation.

item.title: Ticket #1998 ("Size of the post box" input box too small) updated
item.dc:creator: jeroenl
item.description:
Issue present on Safari 2.0.4 too, while Firefox 1.5.0.4 looks fine on OSX.

Setting the related value to 2em works perfectly on OSX, but show "wide" on firefox. I'm guessing it's something font related.

Using ex units doesn't help either, px is fixed. My siggestion is to keep it like it is. OSX is the smallest userbase.

IMO this should be closed. You are in the EDIT CATEGORY panel, so Edit Category is the action that occurs when you click on the button. Not worth keeping on the active bug list, that's for sure.

item.title: Ticket #2892 (JS confirmation dialog for deletion in 'manage posts') updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: [3906] converts the 039s to a quote and then backslashes. See #2851.

item.title: Ticket #2734 (Nonce confirmation not informative.) closed
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: fixed

item.title: Ticket #2892 (JS confirmation dialog for deletion in 'manage posts') created
item.dc:creator: c0ldfusi0nz
item.description:
Line #213 in wp-admin/edit.php

The javascript confirmation dialog fails to appear when trying to delete a post under 'manage posts' if the title of the post contains any single quotes. Thus the post is deleted without confirmation.

I see that wp_specialchars is encoding single quotes in the title as ' but the JS is converting that back to a single quote which ends the message string early and results in the popup dialog's failure to appear. I would recommend adding some logic to js_escape to make sure any single quotes are getting escaped, such as a str_replace to add a backslash in front of the ' chars.

item.title: Ticket #2821 (RBL used for comment spam check gone) updated
item.dc:creator: jabesse
item.description: Off by default: as sbl-xbl.spamhaus.org lists quite some hosts, there is some risk of false positives. Therefor: +1 for off by default. (And some documentation about it?)

item.title: Ticket #2773 (mysql server connections are being left open causing low system ...) closed
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description:
invalid:

You can always modify your wp install to accomodate for this. It might be your sql version or a problem with the sql installation on the server. Anyways, it's a problem on your end and you have to connect your web host. Also, upgrade to 2.0.3 if you haven't already.

item.title: Ticket #2877 (A Slash too much @ get_pagenum_link()) updated
item.dc:creator: darkfate
item.description: No, it's that way in the english version. I don't think that would fix it and there would be a problem with that. Putting the slash in front like you did would make the server redirect to root. So if you have wordpress in a directory it would screw up like so: You would want this: ​http://site.com/wordpress/testing/1/ But you would get this: ​http://site.com/testing/1/
